question: Some strains of Bacillus thuringiensis produce proteins that kill insects. Which one of the following is not killed by proteins of Bacillus thuringiensis?
explanation: Bt toxins kill lepidopterans (armyworm, budworm), coleopterans, and dipterans. Tapeworms are not insects and are not targets of Bt toxin [cite: 230-236, 478].
